First, I'll recall what I know about reflexes and their root values. The biceps reflex is part of the upper motor neuron testing. The biceps reflex is tested by tapping the biceps tendon, which is located in the antecubital fossa. The root value for this reflex is C5 and C6. Wait, so option A says the root value is C5 and C6. That seems right. But I should check the other options too.

Option B says if no reflex is elicited when tapping a tendon, it's documented as absent. Hmm, I think that's correct. In clinical practice, if a reflex isn't elicited, it's considered absent. But sometimes, maybe a weak reflex is considered hyporeflexia. But the question says "no reflex" which would be absent. So B might be correct.

Option C says the triceps tendon is struck in the antecubital fossa. Wait, the triceps tendon is located in the elbow area, right? The antecubital fossa is the area in front of the elbow. So when testing the triceps reflex, you tap the triceps tendon, which is in the antecubital fossa. So C is correct?
